name: op1std
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wceq(c0, cop(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c1st, c0), c1))

stmt.origin: syl6eq(cfv(c1st, c0), c1, cfv(c1st, cop(c1, c2)), wceq(c0, cop(c1, c2)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wceq(c0, cop(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c1st, c0), c1))
-| wi(wceq(c0, cop(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c1st, cop(c1, c2))))
-| wceq(cfv(c1st, cop(c1, c2)), c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wceq(c0, cop(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c1st, c0), c1))
-| wi(wceq(c0, cop(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c1st, cop(c1, c2))))
-| wceq(cfv(c1st, cop(c1, c2)), c1)

body.origin: |- wi(wceq(c0, cop(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c1st, cop(c1, c2))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wceq(c0, cop(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c1st, c0), c1))
-| wceq(cfv(c1st, cop(c1, c2)), c1)

body.origin:
|- wceq(cfv(c1st, cop(c1, c2)), c1)
-| wcel(c1, universe)
-| wcel(c2, universe)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wceq(c0, cop(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c1st, c0), c1))
-| wcel(c1, universe)
-| wcel(c2, universe)

comment: Extract the first member of an ordered pair. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
